cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (65 km) SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest tonight, then turning northwest on Sunday–Monday toward central/western Cuba, the Florida Straits, the eastern Gulf, and then up the U.S. southeast coast toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic late in the 5-day period.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm and Hurricane watches confined to parts of Cuba, the Cayman Islands, and the Florida Keys (west of Craig Key to Dry Tortugas).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm warnings for southern Haiti, Jamaica, and eastern/central Cuba.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, Florida Keys and west coast of Florida, then likely Georgia–Carolina coasts later in the period.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds as a weakened system passes near or south of the port late next week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York / New Jersey coast based on current track well to the south of the uncertainty cone.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible late next week; current guidance suggests totals below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal rip-current risk late next week if the storm’s remnants track offshore.
